content: infinity scarf an easy scarf you can knit from scrap yarn the infinity scarf is a quick and beginner friendly scarf to knit on a circular needle there is not much technique involved you can knit in one or several colors and the short repeats are particularly suitable for using several colors of scrap yarns you will need approximately 60 g of yarn for one scarf knitting gauge 19 stitches/10 cm 4 the gauge is supposed to be a bit loose cast on 100-104 stitches on circular needle no 7 4 5mm or no 8 5 mm 50 cm 20 long note this cowl is worked in the round do not turn your work before you join 1 arrange all of your stitches so they are not twisted 2 now turn the stitches on your left needle 3 full turns so that your stitches wind around the circular needle 3 then join to work in the round knit 10 row and purl 1 row the right side becomes the wrong side of the finished work *change color or don t purl 2 row knit 7 row purl 1 row* repeat *-* 4-5 times until you now have a total of 5-6 repeats of stockinette stitch on the work change color again or don t and purl 2 row knit 10 row cast off normally - not too tight cut your yarn weave in the ends and turn inside out done the scarves shown in the picture is made from wool yarn which normally has a knitting gauge of 21 stitches and 28 row per 10 x 10 cm right onion no 4 organic wool + nettles 50 g/130 m 100 stitches needle 4 5 mm left mondial australia 100 % wool 50g/110 m 104 stitches needle 5 mm this pattern is designed by kreativiteket© infinity scarf is a free pattern and you can use it and share it as much as you like but please use hashtag #kreativitekdk if you post and share on instagram  this pattern has been translated with help from @marlene_craftingqueen
